title: Steve Borthwick expresses concern for safety of people of Japan as Typhoon Hagibis bears down on Tokyo
text:
Steve Borthwick, has expressed his concern for the safety of people of Japan, including friends and family of the England squad, as Typhoon Hagibis, the largest tropical cyclone to have made landfall in the country for over 60 years, bears down on the capital city of Tokyo.

Tokyo and the surrounding Kanto area is on an emergency lockdown, with winds of up to 120mph already battering the south-east region of the country, with at least one person confirmed to have been killed when his car was overturned by a tornado.

England relocated from Tokyo to the coastal resort of Miyazaki over 700 miles south of capital on Thursday after their final pool C match against France, which was due to take place...
description: Steve Borthwick, has expressed his concern for the safety of people of Japan, including friends and family of the England squad, as Typhoon Hagibis, the largest tropical cyclone to have made landfall in the country for over 60 years, bears down on the capital city of Tokyo.
